result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony L Evens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and DNA costs to be paid within 60 days; alternate 15 days jail.
DNA paid along with fine in 60 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Anthony L Evens in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a no contest plea as to the amended charge. Court imposed the following sentence:

Fine:  $568.00
DNA Surcharge: $200.00
Defendant to pay within 60 days or alternate of 15 days jail
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-18-2016 09:30 am

Defendant Anthony L Evens in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for his client to undergo some counseling and have this matter set for plea and sentencing. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 09:30 am.
